speaker: Skyline
text: A helicopter rises above the buildings._   [_Scene 1 - Frasier's apartment. Martin and Daphne are sitting at the table._]

speaker: Martin
text: A hell of a breakfast, Daph.  I'm stuffed.

speaker: Daphne
text: Thanks.  Now come on, let's do some exercises.

speaker: Martin
text: And risk a cramp?  What kind of training did you get?  [_Frasier enters_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Good morning. [_He sits._]

speaker: Martin
text: Hi, Fras.

speaker: Daphne
text: Morning.

speaker: Martin
text: Want some breakfast?

speaker: Frasier
text: Um, no thanks.  Coffee will be fine.  Hi, Daph, uh, listen.  I could use an objective opinion.  I am running for condo board president, and I want to know what you think of this as a slogan: "Frasier Crane--The People's Elixir." [_He beams._]

speaker: Martin
text: OK, I'm ready for my exercises now.

speaker: Frasier
text: Please, Dad, this is serious!  I have a feeling this could be my year.

speaker: Daphne
text: Don't you say that every year.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I do, but this year, I am the only one running against the incumbent, which means the people will rally their inchoate yearnings for change behind my banner.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, you're full of catchy slogans.  Frasier, don't get your hopes up too high, I mean, name one person on the condo board you haven't ticked off at least once.

speaker: Frasier
text: That's just because I have a Type-A, hands-on, get-it-done personality.

speaker: Martin
text: Seriously, name one.  You know, Fras, you might be the best man for the job, but a friendly smile and a "How do you do" in the hallway goes a lot further than being "The People's Laxative."

speaker: Frasier
text: [_indignantly_] _Elixir!_  Well, I suppose you're right.  I haven't really established myself as the neighborly sort.  I thought that my term as fire safety captain might do the trick, but...I guess I drilled them once too often.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_to Martin_] Maybe you could give him lessons on how to be a normal person.

speaker: Frasier
text: I beg your pardon?  Say, I've got an idea.  Dad, why don't you just run?

speaker: Martin
text: Why would I want to do that?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, because then the people would get their regular guy, but he would have my political agenda.

speaker: Daphne
text: I get it.  Your father's the figurehead.  Like Woodrow Wilson when he had that stroke and his wife secretly acted as president.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, exactly, but of course Dad would be conscious, presumably.

speaker: Martin
text: How did you know about that?

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm studying for my citizenship exam.  It's about time I became am American like everyone else. [_She goes to the kitchen._]

speaker: Frasier
text: If you were like everyone else, you wouldn't know any history. So, Dad, what do you think?

speaker: Martin
text: I don't know, it sounds like a big pain.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, come on, Dad.  Think of the neighbors.  Think of the building, the good we could do together.  We can actually achieve the dream of luxury apartment living that our founders intended.  Plus, I'll do all the work.

speaker: Martin
text: I'll tell you something I always thought we needed: wider parking spaces so the doors don't get dinged.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, you do this for me, I'll make sure that gets done.

speaker: Martin
text: Really?

speaker: Frasier
text: Absolutely...Mr. President!

speaker: Martin
text: I like the sound of that. [_They laugh._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Now I think I should still run against you. [_He rises to exit._]

speaker: Martin
text: Why?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_walking to the door_] Well, if I drop out just as you announce your candidacy, people might suspect something's up.  It's better that our political legerdemain remain sub rosa, hmm? How would a normal person say that, Dad?

speaker: Martin
text: No one needs to know how the hot dogs are made.

speaker: Frasier
text: This is going to be sweet.  [_He exits.  Fade out._]  [_Scene 2 - Condo Board Conference Room Frasier is addressing the board._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Which brings me to my final opponent.  Martin Crane.  Now we're all aware that he is a decorated war hero and a much-honored police officer, but does he have the building's interests at heart? [_hamming_] Maybe.  I simply ask that you stack up his 45 years of experience against my term as fire safety captain. Thank you.  And God bless Elliot Bay Towers.  [_There is very light applause.  Paul, a presiding board member, rises._]

speaker: Paul
text: And now we'll hear from Martin Crane.  [_The applause for Martin is much louder than it was for Frasier._]

speaker: Martin
text: Uh, thanks, uh, I'm Marty Crane, uh I just want to say that it's a privilege to run and, uh, I'll try to do the best I can.  Go Seahawks!  [_More loud applause follows.  Frasier hams his enthusiastic applause._]

speaker: Paul
text: Um, here's where we hear from our third candidate, current president Jim McIntyre, but uh, last night he informed me that he was giving up condo board in order to pursue his dream of teaching English as a second language.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to Martin_] Dream? Or court-ordered community service?

speaker: Paul
text: So, I guess it's time to vote.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I wish we would have known that guy wasn't going to run. I wouldn't have had to spend all night working on my speech.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, plus, I would automatically be president now.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, even you couldn't lose a one-man election.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hmm, are you forgetting 1998?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, yeah, when you lost to the dead guy.

speaker: Frasier
text: He wasn't dead he was in a coma.  How was I supposed to compete with that?

speaker: Paul
text: OK, ladies and gentlemen, we have a winner.  In a surprisingly close vote of fifteen to two, our new president is Martin Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes!  I got two votes!  [_Martin chuckles, somewhat embarassed.  Fade out._]  [_Scene 3 - The Montana apartment. Daphne is showing a woman out of the door.  She and Niles are both wearing bathrobes.  Niles is relaxed on a chair._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Bye-bye.  Uh, what a great massage.  It's too bad her English wasn't better.  She could have told us some of her secrets. [_She sits next to him and takes his hand._]

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, but now we know that Urdu is the official language of heaven.  I could go for a snack.  Want some p�te?

speaker: Daphne
text: No thanks.

speaker: Niles
text: Some cheese?

speaker: Daphne
text: No.

speaker: Niles
text: P�te?

speaker: Daphne
text: Again, no.  How about some salad?

speaker: Niles
text: Or a fruit salad.  I could throw together a little melange.  [_The doorbell rings._]

speaker: Daphne
text: I'll get it.  A melange sounds lovely. [_She answers.  It is Roz._] Roz, I thought you were going out with that man from your gym.

speaker: Roz
text: We didn't even make it to dinner.  Here's your never-fail date purse back.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, I'm sorry. No, come on in.

speaker: Roz
text: Are you sure?  You look like you're going to bed.

speaker: Daphne
text: No, we just got a massage.  Come in.

speaker: Roz
text: [_imitating Daphne's pronounciation of the word_] Oh.  Boy a

speaker: Daphne
text: She did the most incredible thing to my neck.  Here, let me show you.  [_Roz sits.  Daphne massages her neck._]

speaker: Roz
text: Hmm. Oh, Mmm-hmm.

speaker: Daphne
text: So how could you tell your date wasn't meant to be?

speaker: Roz
text: He had the same purse.  Wow, that feels so good!

speaker: Daphne
text: Mmm-hmm.  [_Niles enters from the kitchen._]

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, hi Roz!

speaker: Roz
text: Hi!

speaker: Daphne
text: Poor thing had a bad date.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I'm sorry.  Well, now that Daphne's helping you to relax, do you want to join us in a little melange?  [_Roz suddenly stiffens and has a very troubled, shocked look on her face. Daphne continues to massage her shoulders, and there is a pause._]

speaker: Roz
text: [_weakly_] What?

speaker: Daphne
text: You'll love it.  Niles is amazing.

speaker: Roz
text: Wait, what are you saying?

speaker: Daphne
text: Unless you have other plans.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, I guess not, but...

speaker: Niles
text: [_handing her the fruit salad_] Than here you go.

speaker: Roz
text: [_relieved_] Oh.  Fruit salad.  Oh my God, I thought you said menage!  [_They all laugh hysterically.  Roz eats the salad.  Daphne stops the massage and sits._]

speaker: Niles
text: Well, the fruits do mix a little promiscuously.

speaker: Roz
text: I was thinking, "Oh my God, what are they saying?"

speaker: Niles
text: Rest assured, we would have offered you something more than fruit salad to get you in the mood. [_They continue to laugh._]

speaker: Daphne
text: You know what?  She didn't say no.

speaker: Niles
text: You're right, she didn't.

speaker: Roz
text: It was only because it was so weird, I didn't know what to say.

speaker: Daphne
text: Is that why?

speaker: Niles
text: I think someone has a little crush on us.

speaker: Roz
text: You wish.

speaker: Daphne
text: We know what you wish. [_Niles laughs._]

speaker: Roz
text: Okay, Okay.  Let's talk about something else.  What are you guys going to do this weekend?

speaker: Niles
text: [_sitting next to Daphne_] You, if you get your way. [_Niles and Daphne continue to guffaw.  Roz becomes visibly irritated._]

speaker: Daphne
text: So, if we had have asked you, you would have said no?

speaker: Roz
text: Of course I would have.

speaker: Niles
text: I see, and what's wrong with us?

speaker: Daphne
text: Do you find us unattractive?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, what if we wore masks?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, they'd have to be Nixon and Frakenstein.  That's all we've got.

speaker: Roz
text: All right, you guys!  Stop it!  I'm sorry I didn't understand your little code word for fruit salad.

speaker: Daphne
text: We're sorry.  Here you haven't even had dinner and we're teasing you.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, you haven't?  I didn't know that.  Let me make you something.

speaker: Roz
text: No, it's OK, I'm not that hungry.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, come on.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, all right.  I wouldn't say no to a sandwich.  [_This is too much for Niles and Daphne.  They cannot resist and begin to giggle again.  Roz, unamused, rises indignantly to leave.  Fade out._]  [_Scene 4 - Frasier's apartment. Frasier is speaking on the phone.  Martin is in his usual position._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, he is doing a hell of a job, isn't he?  Oh, listen, what did you think of the new plants in the lobby?  Dad was particularly pleased with how they complimented the filigree in the sconces.

speaker: Martin
text: Don't tell people that!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I suppose the best man did win.  Bye-bye.  Another satisfied constituent.

speaker: Martin
text: [_sarcastically_] Well, whoop-de-do.  [_The doorbell rings.  Frasier answers.  It is Paul._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello.

speaker: Paul
text: Hi, Frasier.  Hey, Marty [_He rushes to Martin in admiration._]

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Paul.

speaker: Paul
text: I just came down to congratulate you.  Every president talks about getting new dryers, but you finally did something about it.

speaker: Frasier
text: You see, Dad.  They love what you're doing for the building! Of course, the sting of losing was quite painful.  But it's worth it, if we can have a laundry room that takes us into the 21st Century.

speaker: Paul
text: You're being a good sport about this, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you know, public-spiritedness is the Crane code.

speaker: Martin
text: Right on! Uh, Paul, could you, uh...[_He gestures for Paul to step out of his line of vision to the television._]

speaker: Paul
text: Oh, sure.  Uh, hey, is it OK if I move the recycling bins down to the landing at the bottom of the stairs?

speaker: Martin
text: Knock yourself out.

speaker: Paul
text: Great, thanks. [_He exits._]  [_Frasier has a sudden indignant look.  He glares at Martin._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Is this going to be a problem?

speaker: Martin
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: I think we need to reach a little understanding.  If someone asks you a question, you look at me.  If I scratch my nose [_he demonstrates_], it means "No."  You get it?  They both begin with the same two letters: "N-O." [_Martin rolls his eye in disgust._] Now if I touch my eye [_again demonstrating_], it means "aye," as in "yes."

speaker: Martin
text: Guess what you're being if I touch my ass.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad?

speaker: Martin
text: I think I can at least take care of the no-brainer decisions myself.

speaker: Frasier
text: That is not how this is supposed to work.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I thought how this was supposed to work was that if I agreed to do this, you would do the one thing I asked for.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, wider parking spaces, but I have five years of ideas here to implement first!  [_He sits, demonstrating the papers and files he has laid out on the coffee table._]

speaker: Martin
text: Five years?  By the time I get my parking space I'll be driving a three-wheeled scooter with an oxygen tank on the back!

speaker: Frasier
text: Look, even if I could fast-track it, there are feasability studies to be done.  There's, um, a committee review, and then there's a bidding process.  You can't just hire some guy with a can of paint.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, that's what I'd do.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well that is why you're not in charge. [_Martin is taken aback at this._] Now, here's your agenda for the next meeting.  Make sure you follow it to the letter!

speaker: Martin
text: Yes, master. [_He rises and heads to the kitchen._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, I sense you're chafing under the cruel yoke of public service.  Remember, we must subordinate our own wishes for the good of the building! [_Martin is out of view. Kelsey now does one of his famous Bette Davis takes._] And that is not one of our hand signals!  [_Fade out._]  [_Scene 5 - Conference Room. Martin is sitting at the head table, presiding._]

speaker: Martin
text: Next item, a study to determine the feasability of putting... something on the roof. Any volunteers?

speaker: Frasier
text: I volunteer.  And I would like to explore the idea of putting a patio on the roof.

speaker: Martin
text: All right, well, that about wraps things up.

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh, query?

speaker: Martin
text: [_wearily_] Recognized.

speaker: Frasier
text: Wasn't there, uh, something else you wanted to bring up?

speaker: Martin
text: [_looking at the agenda_] Nope.  Don't think so.

speaker: Frasier
text: Are you sure?  I-I could have sworn I heard the president say something about a-a new ventilation system.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, we've done enough for tonight.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_suddenly short and angry_] No, you haven't! [_Everybody, including Martin, is taken aback.  Frasier recovers._] I'm certain if you simply consult the agenda which you so painstakingly prepared, you will find that there is one last item.

speaker: Martin
text: [_consulting the agenda_] Oh, yeah!  Here it is! Wider parking spaces  [_Various calls of "Oh, that's good!" "Real good."_]

speaker: Paul
text: Great idea, classic Marty!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_in a warning tone_] Are you sure it's not a ventilation system?

speaker: Martin
text: No.  Wider...spaces.  Those in favor of better parking? [_Everyone responds "aye."_] Those opposed to better parking?

speaker: Frasier
text: Nay!

speaker: Martin
text: Motion carries!

speaker: Frasier
text: Query!

speaker: Martin
text: Not recognized.  [_Frasier looks up in supreme indignation._]

speaker: Paul
text: Marty, I'm afraid I have to interrupt.  There's a delivery for you.  Bring it in Mrs. Richman.  [_Mrs. Richman enters, pushing a cart with a cake.  This character's most famous appearance was in the elevator scene of Episode_[[7.23],](/frasier/transcripts/season_7/episode_23/something_borrowed_someone_blue_1.html)_"Something Borrowed, Someone Blue [_I_]."_]

speaker: Richman
text: Here we go.

speaker: Martin
text: Whoa!  A cake!  What's the occasion?

speaker: Paul
text: We wanted to show you our appreciation for all the great things you've done for us.

speaker: Martin
text: [_beaming_] Wow! I never thought I'd see myself in frosting!

speaker: Paul
text: In the last couple of weeks, you've done more for this building than the last two presidents combined. Where did you get all these great ideas?

speaker: Martin
text: [_smiling, but staring pointedly at Frasier_] Oh, I don't know. They just come to me while I'm trying to watch TV.  Why don't you make yourself useful and cut the cake, Fras?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_with venom_] My pleasure, _Mr. President._  [_He grabs the knife with an evil expression, and maliciously slices the cake across the point of Martin's throat in the frosting photo. Martin gets the hint and smiles back at Frasier.  Fade out._]  _END OF ACT I   ACT II_  [_Scene 6 - Frasier's apartment. Frasier is seated at the table with papers, working.  Martin enters._]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_coldly_] Hello.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, don't be sore.  I'll get to the ventilation system eventually.

speaker: Frasier
text: You went back on our agreement.  I'm the one who's supposed to call the shots around here.

speaker: Martin
text: Our agreement was that we'd get wider parking spaces, but you blew me off.  As far as I'm concerned the agreement is over. [_He sits at the table with some food._] Besides, I think I have a knack for this president thing.  Now, I'd like to keep you on my team, but, uh, if it's too rough for you, just say the word. [_He looks at some papers._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, well, well.  The puppet thinks he's a real boy. [_Martin smiles._] I don't think you have the skills for this job.

speaker: Martin
text: I have something better--people skills.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_angrily_] So do I, but these boobs and nincompoops are too stupid to see it!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, if you're so sure you're indispensable, maybe you should run for president.  Oh, wait.  You did, five times.

speaker: Frasier
text: They wouldn't love you so much if it weren't for my ideas!

speaker: Martin
text: Right, because you need a Ph. D. to think about repainting the lobby.  Oh, wait.  You don't.

speaker: Frasier
text: Would you stop doing that?

speaker: Martin
text: You're right.  It's not an effective way to argue.  Oh, wait. It is.  [_Frasier begins to seethe in his chair.  Fade Out._]   **Check Your Seattle Guide Books for Directions**  [_Scene 7 - Cafe Nervosa Daphne and Niles are seated._]

speaker: Daphne
text: [_over fade-in_] Don't you just love this part of American history?

speaker: Niles
text: I'm not much of a Civil War buff.

speaker: Daphne
text: It's fascinating.  Much more so than the English Civil War.

speaker: Niles
text: [_playfully affronted_] Impossible!  Didn't you want to be there when Charles I unfurled his standard at Nottingham in 1642?

speaker: Daphne
text: Ugh.  You sound like school.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, we'll let Frasier settle it.  Which Civil War was more interesting?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_approaching from the counter_] Spanish.  But I don't have time to prove it.  I've got to go confront Evita Per�n at the condo board meeting tonight.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Niles
text: I thought he was doing a good job.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, he was, until he started to think for himself.  He's so damn popular everybody else just follows along.  It's like the blind leading the blind.

speaker: Niles
text: Well...

speaker: Frasier
text: But it will not stand!  As soon as he calls for new business tonight, I am going to leap to my feet and expose him for the power-mad dictator that he's become. [_He hurriedly drinks his coffee._]  Mm-mmm.  Then I'll take over. [_He rises to leave in a rush._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane!  Maybe you should take it easy on your father.

speaker: Frasier
text: Why?!

speaker: Daphne
text: Because he's getting out more, having fun with other people in the building.  You can't take that away from him.

speaker: Niles
text: You get to be a big shot all the time.  This is Dad's turn in the limelight.  It's good for his self-esteem.

speaker: Frasier
text: Why do I even talk to you people?  [_He exits in a rush, passing Roz, who is entering._]

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Not now!

speaker: Roz
text: Okay! [_To Niles and Daphne_] Hi, can I join you guys?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh.

speaker: Daphne
text: I think someone is coming on to us.

speaker: Niles
text: Someone just can't leave us alone. [_They giggle._]

speaker: Roz
text: Okay, you guys have been doing this for over two weeks.  Lay off.

speaker: Niles
text: I thought "laying off" was exactly what you didn't want us to do!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_cracking up_] That's a good one.

speaker: Roz
text: It doesn't even make sense. [_During this speech, her voice gradually increases in volume and the entire cafe becomes quiet as she finishes._] Listen, I don't want to have a threesome with you.  I never wanted to have a threesome with you, and I will not have a threesome with you!  So quit bringing it up!  [_She leaves in a huff.  All are staring at Daphne and Niles._]

speaker: Daphne
text: I think we went a little too far.

speaker: Niles
text: Not as far as she wanted to go. [_They again begin to laugh hysterically.  A bearded man in a leather jacket approaches them._]

speaker: Swinger
text: Excuse me.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes.

speaker: Swinger
text: I'm sorry, I couldn't help overhearing, and as a fellow non-traditional sex enthusiast, our day will come.  Here's my card.

speaker: Niles
text: [_taking the card between two fingers, as if it were toxic_] Thank you.

speaker: Swinger
text: [_as he exits_] Oh, and by the way, a bunch of us get together over at the SeaTac Hyatt second Saturday of every month.  And if you want to just tape your wife with another dude, that's cool. [_He exits._]  [_Niles and Daphne shudder in disgust.  Niles, holding the card as he would a dirty diaper, quickly drops it on the table, whereupon he immediately grabs a wet wipe and cleans his fingers.  Fade out._]  [_Scene 8 - Conference Room. Frasier enters, late.  Martin, Paul, and Mrs. Richman are at the head table._]

speaker: Martin
text: Thank you, Mrs. Richman, and for anyone who needs reminding, these meetings start at 8:00, not 8:07. [_He looks at his watch._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Noted.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, shall we open the floor up to new business?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_quickly rising_] Yes! Yes! Yes!  It's time you people understood the real kind of pres...  [_He is interrupted by a tenant, Albert.  This character has appeared before, most notably in Niles's version of Episode_[[5.09],](/frasier/transcripts/season_5/episode_9/perspectives_on_christmas.html)_"Perspectives on Christmas."_]

speaker: Albert
text: Hold it, Crane.  I got real business here.  Can you tell us when we're going to be able to get our cars back into the parking garage?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh yeah, uh, the lines should get their second coat tomorrow, and if it doesn't rain, they should be dry by the end of the week.

speaker: Albert
text: Uh huh, and in the meantime we have to park out on the street!

speaker: Martin
text: I know it's a little inconvenient, but...

speaker: Albert
text: Inconvenient?!  I got a ticket!

speaker: Jerry
text: [_another tenant_] Yeah! My wife got towed.

speaker: Martin
text: But after it's done we'll have wider parking spaces.

speaker: Cecilia
text: [_another tenant_] If you make them wider, aren't we going to lose some spaces?  Where are those people supposed to go?

speaker: Martin
text: Um, well, uh, maybe we could take turns.  [_The crowd is beginning to get angry, responding with "Take turns?!, etc.  Frasier begins to show some empathy toward his ambushed father in his facial expressions._]

speaker: Martin
text: Does everybody here need their car?  [_The crowd again shouts all at once._]

speaker: Albert
text: Of course we need a car!

speaker: Jerry
text: Have you got a copy of the feasability report?

speaker: Martin
text: [_shuffling through papers_] Yeah, feasibility report, uh, yes, the, um, feasibility report.

speaker: Albert
text: You only have one piece of paper there.

speaker: Paul
text: How long will it take before we get them painted back the right way?

speaker: Jerry
text: And who's going to pay for all the tickets we get?

speaker: Cecilia
text: I had to lug my groceries three blocks!  [_They continue to murmur all at once._]

speaker: Martin
text: Look, I'm sorry, I...

speaker: Paul
text: What, did you just hire a guy with a can of paint?

speaker: Martin
text: [_feigning outrage_] No!  [_The crowd increases in its unrest.  Martin has clearly lost control of the situation.  Frasier suddenly rises._]

speaker: Frasier
text: People! People!  If you'd just let him talk, he could explain. My father is currently in negotiations with a salvage company to remove the old boiler room, which would give us the extra spaces we need.

speaker: Paul
text: Where are we going to park in the meantime?

speaker: Frasier
text: My father has already discussed with the building next door sharing their parking spaces.  Isn't that right, Dad?

speaker: Martin
text: [_thankful for the bailout, he pretends to check the papers_] Uh...Yeah, right!

speaker: Paul
text: We should have had more faith in you!  You've had a lot of good ideas so far.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, actually, I've got something to tell you about those good ideas.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad. [_He frantically rubs his nose and shakes his head._]

speaker: Martin
text: All that good stuff...all the stuff you were crazy about... it all came from Frasier. [_He rises and moves toward his son._] From the very beginning, he's been the one running things and I think we should give him a little credit. [_He pats Frasier on the shoulder._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well thank you, Dad, that's very kind of you.

speaker: Martin
text: In fact, uh, having me run was Frasier's idea.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_attempting to interrupt, frantically rubbing his nose again_] Dad!

speaker: Martin
text: [_waving him off_] He figured that...he figured that you'd go for his policies if they came from somebody else.

speaker: Albert
text: [_shaking his finger_] So this whole thing was a scam.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I wouldn't call it a scam.  It was just a fake-out.

speaker: Jerry
text: Frasier, how could you do your father like this?

speaker: Richman
text: He's always wanted to be president, but I never thought he would stoop this low!

speaker: Martin
text: All right, that's enough!  My son is the best thing that ever happened to this condo board, but you guys are too petty to see it!  Well, you people don't deserve him!  And if you don't want him, you don't get me either.  I resign.  Come on, Fras. [_He heads for the exit._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Right behind you, Dad.

speaker: Jerry
text: Now what do we do?

speaker: Paul
text: Well, technically, when the president resigns, the runner-up takes power.  [_In exiting, Frasier hears this and stops in the doorway.  Everyone looks back at him, stunned._]
